column4: New Installation Xubuntu 6.10 and can not get Video on monitor unless I go to a command prompt (Ctrl + Alt + F1).  Begins to load I see xubuntu logo then screen goes blank and monitor goes dead.  Please help me with this.  Its been going on for tow weeks and I really want to get this working.  Note monitor works with Puppy linus live Cd.. but not with xbuntu.   Also when I go to a command prompt its says 1024*768 failed , upsplash: 800-60
I cant figure out how to edit xorg and have been at this for 2.5 weeks now :(
what graphics card do you have?
look in /var/log/Xorg.0.log and see if you find any meaningful error messages (lines starting with '(EE)' )
less /var/log/Xorg.0.log, then when the pager comes up, type /\(EE\) to search for (EE)
then hit n for the next hit
I have those messages in mine too (and mines working) so I think can ignore those... nothing else?
then it sounds like it's just the monitor sync rates that need to be set properly
I would try searching for <monitor brand> <monitor model> specs on google
you can edit it manually with sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf, or run sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg to get a "Wizard" to do it
yea, it might work to copy the Monitor section
then edit xorg manually with sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf
in nano, hit Ctrl+w to search for Monitor
sudo with o as in sudoku ;)
/etc/X11/xorg.conf
ect?
again, ect should be etc ...
use tab-completion, hit <TAB> while writing
ok
sudo nano /*/*/xorg.conf<TAB> should automagicaly replace the two stars with the correct path
sudo /etc/init.d/?dm restart should tell you if it worked
